titles.title: Continuing Appropriation FY2000 (Sixth)
Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2000, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 381 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 80 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Waives all points of order.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 381.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 80 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Waives all points of order.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 80.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 403 - 8 (Roll no. 596).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

bill.summary: 11/16/1999--Introduced. Extends the law making continuing appropriations for FY 2000 through November 18, 1999.Extends, until November 18, 1999, a certain provision of law that allows fewer than three members of the Board of Directors of the Export-Import Bank of the United States to constitute a quorum.
